oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Flooded farm
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A river overflowing its banks reaches homes, barns, and other outbuildings, possibly along the Mississippi River. Buildings are surrounded by water and trees, and their trunks are underwater.

The Great Mississippi Flood of 1912 was, at its time, the worst flood on record. North Memphis was badly flooded, as was Lake County, Tennessee. The Wolf River and the Gayoso Bayou overflowed their banks following week after week of rain storms. The cataclysm killed an estimated 1,000 people and displaced 30,000 others. Damage was put at $50 million.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Earl S. Miers River Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Floods; Bodies of water; Disasters
